definition: branch road/setback/accident/hiccup
fork in road/bifurcation/branch in road, river, mountain range etc/to branch off/to turn off/to diverge/to stray (from the path)/to change the subject/to interrupt/to stagger (times)
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
to look for blemishes/to find fault/nitpicking

sentences.english: The boss kept pecking at the clerk to force him to resign.
sentences.chinese: 老板不断找那个职员的岔子，想迫使他辞职。

sentences.english: They went through the details of the plan over and over again to make sure that there was no possibility of failure.
sentences.chinese: 为了保证不出岔子，他们把计划的细节反复作了推敲。

sentences.english: She nagged at him all day long.
sentences.chinese: 她成天唠唠叨叨地找他岔子。

sentences.english: In a general way that's missing his tip , " Mr. Childers answered."
sentences.chinese: “一般说来，这就是出岔子，”齐儿德斯先生回答说。

sentences.english: How could anything gone wrong yet, you haven't started it, right? So it's perfect.
sentences.chinese: 如果还没开始，又怎么可能出岔子呢？，太完美了。

sentences.english: We need to have several rehearsals so we don't make any mistakes during the final performance.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止在正式演出时出岔子，我们彩排了好多遍。

sentences.english: We don't like the new leader, for he is always on to us.
sentences.chinese: 我们不喜欢新来的领导，因为他老找我们岔子。

sentences.english: He admitted he might have dropped his first managerial clanger .
sentences.chinese: 他承认自己可能在管理上出了第一个岔子。

sentences.english: They always pick on him when anything goes wrong.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有什么事出了差错，他们总是找他的岔子。

sentences.english: Don't jump at me all the time.
Why must you always knock my driving?
sentences.chinese: 你干嘛老要找我开车的岔子。

sentences.english: Every fool can find faults that wise man cannot remedy.
sentences.chinese: 笨伯也能找出聪灵人无法补充的岔子来的。

definition: mistake/slip-up/fault/error (in data transmission)/accident/mishap
careless mistake/slip-up
to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
mistake/error/mishap
to dispose of a matter/to be done with it
to go wrong/to get into trouble
disturbance/incident
disaster/doom
to take a wrong turn/to go wrong
variant of 差池[cha1 chi2]
social gaffe or blunder/faux pas/see 出洋相[chu1 yang2 xiang4]
mishap/accident/accidental loss
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
trouble/blunder
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
unexpected/measureless/unexpected circumstance/contingency/mishap
